data: For outpatients, give applicable teaching materials and review with patient including surgery instruction sheet from surgeon
Instruct patient to shower evening prior to surgery
Instruct patient to cleanse skin with chlorhexidine 4% soap OR chlorhexidine gluconate 2% wipes (SAGE-Antiseptic Body Cleanser) as per instructions following shower
Starting now. Liquids must be clear. Please instruct the patient to avoid any juices that contains pulp
NPO after midnight if patient is pregnant, has been diagnosed with GERD or diabetic gastroparesis, had trauma or gastric surgery, or received opioid analgesics in the last 12 hours
For Outpatient - Pre-admission instructions for patient to complete prior to coming to the hospital
Carbohydrate Loading (not applicable for diabetic patients on insulin)
On evening prior to surgery: drink 500 mL of clear juice (e.g. apple juice) or 2 packages of PREcovery (dilute package in 400 mL water and drink over 2 hours)
For patient with NO bowel preparation: No solid food after midnight. Clear fluids after midnight and up to 1 hour before hospital check-in time
For patient who received bowel preparation: No solid food after bowel preparation. Clear fluids only after bowel preparation and up to 1 hour before hospital check-in time

Nothing by mouth after midnight. Only drink clear juice or PREcovery on evening prior to surgery (Drink 500 mL of clear juice (e.g. apple juice) or 2 packages of PREcovery (dilute each package in 400 mL water and drink over 2 hours))
For Inpatients - Pre-surgical instructions for in-patients in the hospital to complete prior to surgical procedure
Carbohydrate Loading (not applicable for diabetic patients on insulin)
Hold PREcovery and juice for diabetic patients on insulin; call MD if patient receiving sliding scale insulin
On evening prior to surgery: drink 500 mL of clear juice (e.g. apple juice) or 2 packages of PREcovery (dilute package in 400 mL water and drink over 2 hours)
For patients with NO bowel preparation: No solid food after midnight and clear fluids after midnight and up to 3 hours prior to slated OR time
For patient who received bowel preparation: No solid food after bowel preparation and clear fluids only after bowel preparation and up to 3 hours prior to slated OR time

Nothing by mouth after midnight. Only drink clear juice or PREcovery on evening prior to surgery (Drink 500 mL of clear juice (e.g. apple juice) or 2 packages of PREcovery (dilute each package in 400 mL water and drink over 2 hours))
T;N, NPO after midnight if patient is pregnant, has been diagnosed with GERD or diabetic gastroparesis, had trauma or gastric surgery, or received opioid analgesics in the last 12 hours
For Outpatient - Bowel Preparation Patient Instructions
Instruct patient to have the following bowel preparation: BI-PEGLYTE (PEG 3350 with electrolytes AND bisaCODYL 5 mg tablets bowel preparation - patient to purchase from retail pharmacy)
15 mg, PO, qHS, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: tab
4,000 mL, PO, once, drug form: powder
2,000 mL, PO, once, drug form: powder
1,000 mg, PO, as directed, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: tab
1,000 mg, PO, as directed, Prophylaxis, Surgical, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: cap
130 mL, rectal, pre-procedure, drug form: enema, start: T;0600
For patients seen in PAC the day before surgery, adjust prep times below
Instruct patient to have the following bowel preparation: BI-PEGLYTE (PEG 3350 with electrolytes AND bisaCODYL 5 mg tablets bowel preparation - patient to purchase from retail pharmacy)
